content.description: Obvious juggy/flake line out the right end of the cave.  There's a sit-start that goes at v8.
content.location: Right side of Ali Bubba Cave

content.description: Sit start on a jug and work your way out the small roof and up to the two holds above the lip.
content.location: This is the first boulder you encounter in the Ali Bubba Cave, on the far left side of the cave to the left of Bubba Hotep.

content.description: Start on an obvious protruding jug, and make your way out the horizontal roof using slopers, edges, and a couple fall-into-underclings. Whirligig your feet over to some of Bubba Hotep's handholds, get ready for some bicep-burl on some slopers, and look for the kneebar that's led to this problem getting more of a v10 than its original v11. You'll be psyched for some incut edges at the end to keep you from back-dabbing. Drop-off finish.
content.location: Just right of Bubba Hotep, left of Ali Bubba.

content.description:
Not sure how to grade this, as I thought the move wasn't too bad but my friends disagreed.

Start about 6-8ft left of Ruth's Roof on the obvious protruding pillar-jug. Power out a large shouldery move to the flake, and match. traverse over the flake and finish as for Ruth's Roof.

There is an obvious sit to this, where you can link the V9 sit into this climb.

Satisfying power gastons and iron crosses. Start on a jug and do the first shoulder-wrenching sequence to hit a good ear. A long move to a seam crimp and then an even longer move to a jug lead you to a couple of easier moves and a finishing hold over the lip.
content.protection: Pads. Careful with the boulder at your back during the final few moves.
content.location: Just left of Ali Bubba. Start on the obvious jug band at the left side of the cave.

content.description: Stand start to Ali Bubba. Start on the horizontal jug rail at the back of the roof and climb as for Ali Bubba.
content.location: Just to the right of the large boulder at the lip of the roof.

content.description:
The namesake of the cave. Start on an obvious jug rail for the V8, or sit start to bump the grade up to V9.

Long tensiony moves with some wild spinning roof maneuvers ease up as you move towards the lip. Finish on an obvious jug over the lip. Some great gymnastic climbing on this one.

Start on a sculpted near-handlebar jug in the middle of the roof and do a couple of spans up a belly-like feature. Hard heels and body tension are the name of the game here. Keep tight to turn the lip and finish on a jug.
content.protection: Two pads, spotters. Good landing, but half the time you're locked in with heel hooks.
content.location: Starts in the middle of the roof on a good jug and trends rightwards towards the lip.
